  • Field Details

    • MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE

      public static final double MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE
      Margin of significance used for comparing floating-point values.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • requireFinite

      public static double requireFinite(double in)
      The usage of this method is an explicit notation that a given input must be finite. Being non-finite is defined as being the values of Double.NaN, Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.
      Parameters:
      in - The input value to be checked for finiteness.
      Returns:
      The input value if it is finite.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the input value is not finite.

    • requireFinite

      public static float requireFinite(float in)
      The usage of this method is an explicit notation that a given input must be finite. Being non-finite is defined as being the values of Float.NaN, Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY, or Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.
      Parameters:
      in - The input value to be checked for finiteness.
      Returns:
      The input value if it is finite.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the input value is not finite.

    • isZero

      public static boolean isZero(double d)
      Checks if a double value is considered zero within a certain margin of significance.
      Parameters:
      d - The double value to check.
      Returns:
      true if the value is effectively zero, false otherwise.

    • isZero

      public static boolean isZero(float f)
      Checks if a float value is considered zero within a certain margin of significance.
      Parameters:
      f - The float value to check.
      Returns:
      true if the value is effectively zero, false otherwise.

    • isZero

      public static boolean isZero(@Nonnull Vector v)
      Checks if a Vector's magnitude is effectively zero within a certain margin of significance.
      Parameters:
      v - The Vector to check.
      Returns:
      true if the Vector's magnitude is effectively zero, false otherwise.

    • isZero

      public static boolean isZero(@Nonnull Matrix m)
      Checks if all elements in a Matrix are effectively zero within a certain margin of significance.
      Parameters:
      m - The Matrix to check.
      Returns:
      true if all elements in the Matrix are effectively zero, false otherwise.

    • equals

      public static boolean equals(double d1, double d2)
      Compares two double values with a margin of significance.
      Parameters:
      d1 - The first double value.
      d2 - The second double value.
      Returns:
      true if the values are considered equal, within the margin of significance, false otherwise.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A new vector representing the result of the addition.
      Throws:
